ext_descriptions.ext_description: A land_connection_zone_class lists the possible classes of the land connection zone.
specifies that the connection zone is a point on a top or bottom surface of a stratum;
specifies that the connection zone is an area on an edge of a stratum;
specifies that the connection zone is a curve on an edge of a stratum that is at the intersection of the edge with the top or bottom surface of a stratum;
specifies that the connection zone is a point on an edge of a stratum;
A measure_orientation lists the values of the measure orientation.
specifies that a value is reversed;
specifies that a value is normal;

ext_description.p: specifies that the connection zone is a area on a top or bottom surface of a stratum.
ext_description.note: The default class is a surface_point_class as that is the commonly understood paradigm in 2D layout CAD systems. The other classes are provided for specialized applications, including microwave design.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A land_template_terminal_class lists the possible classes of the land template terminal.
specifies that the terminal is a point on a top or bottom surface of a stratum;
specifies that the connection zone is an area on an edge of a stratum;
specifies that the terminal is a curve on an edge of a stratum that is at the intersection of the edge with the top or bottom surface of a stratum;
specifies that the terminal is a point on an edge of a stratum;

ext_description.p: specifies that the terminal is a area on a top or bottom surface of a stratum.
ext_description.note: The default class is a surface_point_class as that is the commonly understood paradigm in 2D layout CAD systems. The other classes are provided for specialized applications, including microwave design.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A ptswp_template_shape_model_context lists the possible source contexts for a .

ext_description.p: specifies that the source system context is 'as drilled';
ext_description.note: 'as drilled' in additive processing indicates the value does not include plating steps effects.

ext_description.p: specifies that the source system context is 'as finished';
ext_description.note: 'as finished' in additive processing indicates the value does include plating effects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies that the source system does not export the context for the passage model.
A text_alignment lists the possible values.
specifies that the value is top right;
specifies that the value is top centre;
specifies that the value is top left;
specifies that the value is centre right;
specifies that the value is centre centre;
specifies that the value is centre left centre left;
specifies that the value is bottom right bottom right;
specifies that the value is bottom centre;
specifies that the value is bottom left.
A Blind_passage_template is a type of . The Blind_passage_template includes sufficient data to determine feature properties for passages that do not penetrate the complete substrate.

specifies the role of the
for the Blind_passage_template.

specifies the role of the
for the Blind_passage_template.

specifies the role of the
for the Blind_passage_template.

specifies normal or reversed as the
for the Blind_passage_template. Normal specifies that the orientation is parallel to the normal of the reference surface. Reversed specifies that the orientation is anti-parallel to the normal of the reference surface.

ext_description.p:
A Component_termination_passage_template is a type of
and a type of . The Component_termination_passage_template defines all shape data for the associated
(for which it is the
), and also where the connection (dependency) on passage technology is established for the properties.
ext_description.note: Properties other than shape are to be found in the of_passage_technology.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Component_termination_passage_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Component_termination_passage_template as its . There shall be two or more Component_termination_passage_template_terminals for the Component_termination_passage_template.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared to be for the Component_termination_passage_template.
A Component_termination_passage_template_interface_terminal is a type of , an occurrence of which provides an interface capability to the next level of assembly.
A Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal is a type of , an occurrence of which provides a fabrication join capability, within an optionally constrained set of .

specifies the
for which a connection to the Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal is disallowed. The value of this attribute need not be specified. There may be more than one
for the Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal.

A Component_termination_passage_template_terminal is a type of . A Component_termination_passage_template_terminal is either a
or a .

specifies the for the Component_termination_passage_template_terminal. There shall be one or more Connection_zone_in_layout_templates for each connection_area. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the data is available in the source system, it shall be supplied.

specifies the role of the
for the Component_termination_passage_template_terminal.

The combination of associated_definition and
inherited from
shall be unique within a population of Component_termination_passage_template_terminal.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Connection_zone_in_layout_template is a type of
and a type of . A Connection_zone_in_layout_template is included in a template definition to provide an explicit geometric model of the limited areas in the domain of a terminal that are allowed for a valid connection. If the template definition contains no limitations on the connection area of the terminals associated with the template this Application Object shall not be provided.
ext_description.note: Usual industrial proctice for templates is to ensure that the entire point domain for features designated as terminals is available for connection and the Connection_zone_in_layout_template is redundant.

In the case where the connection area is necessary, the application shall be carefully reviewed to determine the necessity for design instances of the connection area as in most cases, simply using the connection area as a constraint on the allowed location of a joint is sufficient.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Connection_zone_in_layout_template.

specifies the role of the
for the Connection_zone_in_layout_template. There shall exist one or more land_connection_zone_classes for the Connection_zone_in_layout_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Continuous_template is a type of . All the points that make up the domain of the Continuous_template shall be connected, that is any point in the domain of the Continuous_template shall be reachable starting at any other point in the domain.
ext_description.note: Supported representations of Continuous_template are standard implementations of common industrial practice of filled figure and path figure.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
All
of Continuous_template shall be of type .

A Counterbore_passage_template is a type of . A Counterbore_passage_template is a combination of two round coaxial passages. The first passage is either a through-hole or a blind hole, and the orientation of the second passage (the counterbore) is the same as that of the first passage. The first passage is smaller than the second passage, which has a blind bottom condition that mates with the top of the first passage.

specifies the role of the
for the Counterbore_passage_template. The larger_passage specifies the data that is associated with the larger opening of the Counterbore.

specifies the role of the
for the Counterbore_passage_template. The smaller_passage specifies the data that is associated with the smaller opening of the Counterbore.

A Countersunk_passage_template is a type of . A Countersunk_passage_template is a combination of two round coaxial passages, one cylindrical and one tapered. The initial diameter of the tapered passage will be larger than the diameter of the cylindrical passage, and will linearly taper to be the same diameter as the cylindrical passage where the two passages meet.

specifies the role of the
for the Countersunk_passage_template. The tapered_passage specifies the data that is associated with the tapered area of the Countersunk passage.

specifies the role of the
for the Countersunk_passage_template. The constant_diameter_passage specifies the data that is associated with the constant diameter opening of the Countersunk passage.

ext_description.p:
A Fill_area_template is a type of
that may be solid filled, tiled, or hatch filled.
ext_description.note: The internal resolved geometric structure of filled areas is not explicitly represented in this part of ISO 10303 and there are therefore no explicit connectivity relationships to the internal geometric elements of filled areas. Consequently it is not possible to make explicit assertions about a connection to a filled area unless the area is solid filled. Additional design verification based on topological extraction techniques from the layout geometry may be needed if filled areas are used for circuit patterns.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Fill_area_template.

specifies a role of the
for the Fill_area_template.
A Hatch_area_template is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the Hatch_area_template.

specifies the role of the
for the Hatch_area_template. There shall exist not less than one and not more than four Hatch_line_elements for the Hatch_area_template.

specifies a role of the
for the Hatch_area_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Hatch_line_element is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the Hatch_line_element.

specifies a role of the
for the Hatch_line_element.

A Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template is a type of
and a type of . This template shape is dependent only on the shape of the it is intended to mate with.

specifies the role of the
for the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template.
the name of the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template. It shall be ' '.
the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template shall be definitional.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template as its . Fabrication and assembly tolerances define the required shapes and variances for the terminal shapes.
If there is one or more connection area the name 'minimum attachment region size' shall be included in the set of strings.
If there are two or more connection areas one of the names shall be one of 'maximum attachment region size','heel area', 'toe area'.
If there are three or more connection areas two of the names shall be include 'maximum attachment region size','heel area', 'toe area' but the name shall not be repeated.
If there are four connection areas each of the names 'maximum attachment region size','heel area', 'toe area' shall be used but the names shall not be repeated.
There shall be exactly one member of interface_access_mechanisms.

ext_description.p: A Default_passage_based_land_physical_template is a type of . A Default_passage_based_land_physical_template is either a , or a . The shape of a based on this template is dependent on the shape of the passage with which it is associated.
ext_description.note: The usual domain technical reference is ANSI/IPC D-275.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Default_passage_based_land_physical_template. Minimum shape requirements for the Default_passage_based_land_physical_template for a specific fabrication capability are found in . This is the passage for which this template is the default.

A Default_plated_passage_based_land_physical_template is a type of
where the passage type is plated.

The
specified by shall be plated.

If a
is the associated passage technology, then there shall only be Land_template_join_terminals that reference the Default_plated_passage_based_land_physical_template.
A Closed_path_area_with_parameters is a type of .

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Closed_path_area_with_parameters.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Closed_path_area_with_parameters.

A
in the role of centreline inherited from
shall be the type of
that is traced by a moving point that returns to an arbitrary starting .

A
in the role of centreline shall not be self intersecting.

A Default_trace_template is a type of . The Default_trace_template is associated with a particular , to allow verification that the design of the trace template meets the relevant minimum and maximum guidelines of that .
specifies the role of the for the Default_trace_template.

A Default_unsupported_passage_based_land_physical_template is a type of
where the passage type is a passage that has no metallized support.

specifies the
for the Default_unsupported_passage_based_land_physical_template.

ext_description.p:
An Electrical_isolation_removal_template is a type of
that describes the shape of material to be removed from a feature in a design when that template is instantiated in the design to achieve electrical isolation. This template is a two dimensional area removal and requires a positive material template to be included in the design internal to this template instance if it is desired to include a connection in the center of the template instance. A specialization of this template is included to support that case.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Electrical_isolation_removal_template. There shall exist one or more Requirement_view_definitions for the Electrical_isolation_removal_template.
The electrical_isolation_spacing_requirement shall be of type .

The
shall not be referenced by the
attribute inherited from the .

Only
shall be referenced by the
attribute inherited from the .

An Inter_stratum_feature_edge_template is a type of
included to support description of properties of the edges of features that traverse one or multiple layers of an interconnect.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_template as its . There shall be two or more for an Inter_stratum_feature_edge_template.

An Inter_stratum_feature_template is a type of . An Inter_stratum_feature_template may be either a , or a , or an , or an , or an . An Inter_stratum_feature_template is a definitional construct that defines the cross-section shape of layered constructs.

specifies the role of the
for the Inter_stratum_feature_template. The of_passage_technology specifies the material and layered properties for the Inter_stratum_feature_template.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p: A Land_physical_template is a type of . A Land_physical_template may be either a or a . If the material the Land_physical_template is composed of it conductive, the Land_physical_template provides the functionality of a short among its terminals. Each member of Land_physical_template that is assigned a classification shall be assigned a unique classification.

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates explicit geometry that represents simplified Land_physical_template.

ext_description.p:
an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Land_physical_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Land_physical_template as its . The pre_defined_classification_code need not be specified for a specific Land_physical_template.
ext_description.note:
IEC 61182-1 provides a set of
identifiers. See figure 2.

The Land_physical_template, , and the Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing capabilities of this part of ISO 10303 may be used to unambiguously exchange the shape of both pre-defined
patterns that include only geometry (as from IEC 61182-1) and enterprise defined patterns. When this facility is used to create more than one equivalent
definition, it may not be possible to maintain knowledge of the connection functionality of the
definition. This is because
is an atomic concept in this part of ISO 10303.

The , , and the Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing capabilities of this part of ISO 10303 may be used to unambiguously exchange both the shape and connection knowledge of
patterns that include pre-defined geometry (as from IEC 61182-1) and enterprise defined geometry that have explicit definitions of the fabrication and assembly constraints.
The Land_physical_template inherit material property data from .
ext_description.p:
When there is a member of pre_defined_classification_code provided, the
attribute of the member shall be the same for all members of Land_physical_template. When there is a member of pre_defined_classification_code provided, no more than one member of Land_physical_template shall reference that be assigned a specific value of the
attribute of .
ext_description.example:
The Land_physical_template #1235 is assigned a
of "Variable octagon" and a
of "IEC 61182-1.land type". See figure 2.
ext_description.note:
A URI may be used for the
and .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Land_physical_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Land_physical_template as its . There shall be one or more
for a Land_physical_template. Fabrication and assembly tolerances define the required shapes and variances for the terminal shapes.

ext_description.p: The access_mechanisms shall include at least one .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: All of Land_physical_template shall be of type .

ext_description.p: There shall be at least one shape.

A Land_template_interface_terminal is a type of that has an external access functionality. A Land_template_interface_terminal redefines the associated_definition attribute inherited from to only reference a .

example.p: Figure 3 is a plan view that illustrates the geometry that represents the interface terminal for a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Land_template_interface_terminal.

ext_description.p:
A Land_template_join_terminal is a type of
that has an internal access functionality.

example.p: Figure 4 is a plan view that illustrates the geometry that represents the join terminal for a . In the plan view, the join terminal is on the periphery.

ext_description.p:
A Land_template_terminal is a type of . A Land_template_terminal is either a
or a . A Land_template_terminal is an area on a
designated for connection in a realization of the template. The terminal_category shall not be supplied if the
is supplied. If the
is supplied but without classification data, a receiving application shall assume the connection is a surface area connection.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
for the Land_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the role of the
for the Land_template_terminal. There may be one or more
for the Land_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the source system contains the data, then the connection_area shall be supplied.

specifies the role of the
for the Land_template_terminal.
The terminal_category shall not be provided if the connection_area is provided.

The
shall not be populated.
Each member of connection_area shall reference the same associated_definition with its attribute .

The combination of associated_definition and
shall be unique within a population of Land_template_terminals.
The points comprising the connection_area shall reside in the shape of the electrical device being accessed.
The points comprising the connection_area shall be defined in the coordinate system of the device being accessed.

ext_description.p:
A Material_removal_feature_template is a type of
that describes the shape of material to be removed from a feature. A Material_removal_feature_template shall not have voids either when represented by an explicit geometric model or when a parametric representation by a path figure is resolved in a receiving system.

example.p: Figure 5 illustrates a template and associated annotation designed for electrical isolation. For a specific template, the explicit geometry will be representative of the annotation values. The illustration includes two templates to support the parameter illustration. The outer template is the Material_removal_feature_template.

Figure 6 illustrates a structure designed for thermal isolation. For this figure, multiple Material_removal_feature_template help compose a structure to achieve the desired configuration. The figure illustrates the end result of the composition process.

figure.title: Material_removal_feature_template participates in structure to support thermal isolation

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.
There shall be at least one shape.
There shall be no voids in the model that represents Material_removal_feature_template.

A Parametric_template is a type of . A Parametric_template is either a
or a , or a .

ext_description.p:
A Part_string_template is a type of
that supports the definitin of a multi-character representation in a design. The Part_string_template is an incompletely modelled concept and requires other Application objects to be populated in an application.
ext_description.note: An application of Part_string_template would normally be in a character array and separately reference the font desired.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
for the Part_string_template.

ext_description.p:
A Part_text_template is a type of
that is the information required to support the creation of text messages in the stratum material on the
or in a marking application.
ext_description.note: The shape of the Part_text_template provided by the of_character attribute is placed in the shape of the physical unit model by a geometric model transformation./>.

The bounding box of the Part_text_template is provided by the
attribute of the
specified by of_character.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Part_text_template. The
is the geometric model of the character.

The of_character attribute shall be a
and one of either a
or a .
A Planar_closed_path_shape_model_with_parameters is a type of . A Planar_closed_path_shape_model_with_parameters is a closed path type of .

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Planar_closed_path_shape_model_with_parameters.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Planar_closed_path_shape_model_with_parameters.

ext_description.p:
Exactly one member of the
attribute inherited from
shall be a .

A Planar_path_shape_model_with_parameters is a type of . A Planar_path_shape_model_with_parameters provides support for certain pre-defined subset of geometric properties for a path based model. There are options on the properties as specified in the
referenced by the parameters attribute. The geometric result of applying a Planar_path_shape_model_with_parameters in a design shall be a single area geometric model whose area is a function of the path length and width. There shall be no voids in the equivalent geometric model.
ext_description.note: If the width parameter of the is zero, the area will be zero and the purpose for including the model in the design is to define a boundary rather than an area. Application of the model in this manner is explicitly described in the Application Object referencing the model in this part of ISO 10303.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Planar_path_shape_model_with_parameters.

specifies the role of the
for the Planar_path_shape_model_with_parameters.

ext_description.p:
Exactly one member of the
attribute inherited from
shall be an .

Exactly one member of the
attribute inherited from
shall be a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: There shall exit exactly two .
A Plated_passage_template_shape_model is a type of .

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Plated_passage_template_shape_model. There shall exist more than one
for the Plated_passage_template_shape_model.

specifies the source qualification for the Plated_passage_template_shape_model shape. The shape may be for the drilled shape, for the finished shape or the context may be unknown in the source system.

specifies the role of a
that is the first element in shape_characterized_definition.
Each passage referenced by Plated_passage_template_shape_model shall be a plated passage.
All templates in the shape_characterized_definition shall be of the same type.

A Single_stratum_continuous_template is a type of
and a type of . A Single_stratum_continuous_template is either a
or a .

A Single_stratum_template is a type of
included that has a constraint that the geometric extent of the template is limited to a single layer.

ext_description.p:
A Snowball_template is a type of
that describes the shape of material to be added to a trace termination that is parameterized by the radius of the material addition geometry. The Snowball_template edge is required to be overlapping the
that is associated by virtue of the that references the occurrence of the Snowball_template. The parameters associated with a Snowball_template allow for one or more shapes to be instantiated with the same . The center of the circle or circles shall be on the centreline curve of the associated
referenced indirectly by the .
ext_description.note:
The occurrence of a Snowball_template will be a
that is referenced by a
by the
attribute.
The is associated because the directly referenced by references a .

ext_description.p: specifies the integer quantity of snowballs.

specifies a role of the
for the Snowball_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Snowball_template.

specifies a role of the
for the Snowball_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Snowball_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Snowball_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Snowball_template.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: If a snowball_quantity_per_trace is greater than zero, the following shall be provided: snowball_end_distance, snowball_initial_spacing, snowball_end_spacing, snowball_initial_radius, snowball_end_radius.

There shall be no
refering this Snowball_template as
and no

and no

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Solid_character_glyph_2d_symbol is a type of
and a type of
included to be an explicit geometric model of a character in a design that may be realized in material delivered to a customer.
ext_description.note: A Solid_character_glyph_2d_symbol is not annotation. It is part of the product geometric model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Stratum_feature_template is a type of that is a definition or partial definition of a . A Stratum_feature_template may be a . A Stratum_feature_template defines a contiguous material shape.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Teardrop_by_angle_template is a type of
that describes the shape of material to be added to a trace termination that is parameterized by the angle of the material addition geometry. The Teardrop_by_angle_template edge is required to be tangential to the
that is associated by virtue of the that references the occurrence of the Teardrop_by_angle_template. The vertex of the angle shall be on the centreline of the
associated by the . The angle shall be less than 90 degrees.
ext_description.note:
The occurrence of a Teardrop_by_angle_template will be a
that is referenced by a
by the
attribute.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Teardrop_by_angle_template.

There shall be no
refering this Teardrop_by_angle_template as
and no
refering this Teardrop_by_angle_template as
and no
refering this Teardrop_by_angle_template as .

The
shall not be populated.

A Teardrop_by_length_template is a type of
that describes the shape of material to be added to a design feature. The teardrop_taper_start_distance and teardrop_taper_end_distance shall be measured from the location of the
of the
referenced by the
that references a
that is an occurrence of Teardrop_by_length_template. The centreline of the
that is an occurrence of the Teardrop_by_length_template shall be congruent with the centreline of the
it is associated with.

specifies one role of the
for the Teardrop_by_length_template.

specifies one role of the
for the Teardrop_by_length_template.

There shall be no
refering this Teardrop_by_length_template as
and no
refering this Teardrop_by_length_template as
and no
refering this Teardrop_by_length_template as .

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Teardrop_template is a type of
and a type of
that supports the transition area between a trace and a land. The application of Teardrop_template in a layout increases yield due to elimination of acid traps and reduced sensitivity to process tolerances.
A Teardrop_template may be either a
or a , or a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
Either the Teardrop_template is one of the subtypes or it shall also be an
but it shall not be one of the supertypes and an .
A Tile_area_template is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the Tile_area_template.

specifies the role of the
for the Tile_area_template.

specifies a role of the
for the Tile_area_template.

specifies a role of the
for the Tile_area_template.

ext_description.p:
A Trace_template is a type of
whose purpose is to define the width of a
and the style of the ends and corners of that . A Trace_template may be a .

specifies the role of the
for the Trace_template.
ext_description.note: The Trace_template uses the parametric information in , not the graphical presentation information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
An Unsupported_passage_template is a type of
and a type of . An Unsupported_passage_template may be either a
or a , or a .
ext_description.note:
The Unsupported_passage_template associates shape information with the
parametric property information. "Unsupported" carries the meaning that the passage is not mechanically or electrically supported by deposited sidewalls.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Unsupported_passage_template.

ext_description.p:
An Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template is a type of
included to support segmentation of edges in an interconnect design.
ext_description.note: In interconnect design, it is typical for one or more segments of the edge of the interconnect to have individually unique properties. The Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template provides structural support to permit an application to explicitly assign properties to individual segments.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
for the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template.

specifies one role of the
for the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template.

specifies one role of the
for the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template.

specifies the role of the
the Inter_stratum_feature_edge_segment_template is helping to compose.

Both
and
of reference_path shall exist.
The start_vertex shall not be equal to the end_vertex.
The start_vertex shall not be equal to the end_vertex.

ext_description.p:
A Via_template is a type of
and a type of .
ext_description.note: A Via_template provides a template for a plated passage that supports the realization of connectivity or of mechanical support. The access_mechanisms attribute relates the Via_template to zero or more terminals, thereby capturing complete connectivity information when the terminals are populated.

A Via_template_terminal is a type of . A Via_template_terminal is a terminal in a . A Via_template_terminal is a terminal that is congruent with the exterior surface of the cylinder of the , including material covered by joined members of . The fabrication join capability is optionally constrained by a set of .
